section.title: Resource Adapter Type
section.para: The resource adapter provides the following types:

formalpara.title: Activities
formalpara.para: The following activities are available, with the API definition listed for reference. The API defines methods to easily create and send answers and requests for a certain activity, in addition to retrieving session-specific data.

section.para: The life cycle of an activity depends on the type of received request and the application interaction. In the case of a subscription activity, the activity timeout is taken into consideration because the subscription may be time-based.

listitem.para: Client accounting activity, which is created for each ACR request. The activity ends when an answer is received, or the request times out.
Client authorization activity, which is created for each RAR request. The activity ends when an answer is received, or the request times out.
Server accounting activity, which is created for each ACR request. The activity ends when an answer is sent, or the request times out.
Server authorization activity, which is created for each RAR request. The activity ends when an answer is sent, or the request times out.

formalpara.title: Provider
formalpara.para: Provider defines the basic features that must be supported by all other providers. Service Building Blocks (SBBs) create activities on demand and retrieve AVP and message factories. The connection information is retrieved from the connected peers.

section.para: The API for the Diameter Provider is more than 100 lines, and therefore can not be included directly for reference. To view the API, refer to DiameterProvider.java in the source code.

formalpara.title: Message Factory
formalpara.para: The Message Factory creates events that can be executed within the JAIN SLEE Server. Depending on the situation, Message Factory completes some AVPs for the session using the information made available to it.

section.para: The API for the Diameter Message Factory is more than 300 lines, and therefore can not be included directly for reference. To view the API, refer to DiameterMessageFactory.java in the source code.
